intro: Spermacoce fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered starapple, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in clusters. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or red when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
